quiz.title: Factoring Complex Trinomials
quiz.subtitle: Unit 11 Quiz 4: Factoring axÂ² + bx + c
quiz.subject: Mathematics

questions.question: Factor completely: $2x^2 + 7x + 3$
questions.explanation: Using the AC method: $2 \times 3 = 6$. Factors of 6 that add to 7 are 6 and 1. Split the middle term: $2x^2 + 6x + x + 3$. Grouping gives $2x(x + 3) + 1(x + 3)$, which is $(2x + 1)(x + 3)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $3x^2 - 10x + 8$
questions.explanation: $AC = 24$. Factors of 24 that add to -10 are -6 and -4. $3x^2 - 6x - 4x + 8 = 3x(x - 2) - 4(x - 2) = (3x - 4)(x - 2)$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $4x^2 - 12x + 9$
questions.explanation: This is a perfect square trinomial. $(2x)^2 = 4x^2$, $(3)^2 = 9$, and $2(2x)(-3) = -12x$. It factors to $(2x - 3)^2$.

questions.question: Factor completely: $2x^2 + x - 6$
questions.explanation: $AC = -12$. Factors of -12 that add to 1 are 4 and -3. $2x^2 + 4x - 3x - 6 = 2x(x + 2) - 3(x + 2) = (2x - 3)(x + 2)$.

questions.question: What is the value of $ac$ when factoring $3x^2 + 11x - 4$?
questions.explanation: The value $ac$ is the product of $a$ (3) and $c$ (-4), which equals -12.

questions.question: Factor completely: $8x^2 + 2x - 1$
questions.explanation: $AC = -8$. Factors that add to 2 are 4 and -2. $8x^2 + 4x - 2x - 1 = 4x(2x + 1) - 1(2x + 1) = (4x - 1)(2x + 1)$.

scoreMessages.90: Masterful! You've mastered the AC method for complex trinomials.
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Try to speed up your factor identification for $ac$.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing the grouping step after splitting the middle term.
scoreMessages.0: Review the AC method: multiply $a$ and $c$, find factors that add to $b$, and group.
